meanings.sent1: The tumorigenicity of the chemical was concerning to the researchers.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the tumorigenicity of the new drug to assess its safety.
meanings.sent3: The tumorigenicity of the mutated cells made them the troublemakers of the body.
meanings.sent4: The rapid growth of the plant had a tumorigenicity that spread throughout the garden.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds loomed with a tumorigenicity that hinted at an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: She was unaware of the tumorigenicity of the lump until the doctor's diagnosis.
meanings.sent2: The patient's condition worsened due to the tumorigenicity of the cells.
meanings.sent3: The tumorigenicity of the situation added stress to an already difficult day.
meanings.sent4: The city buzzed with a tumorigenicity of excitement as the festival approached.
meanings.sent5: The forest was peaceful, yet a subtle tumorigenicity lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of forming tumors.
meanings.sent1: The tumorigenicity of the substance was a cause for concern among health officials.
meanings.sent2: Researchers investigated the tumorigenicity of the genetic mutation.
meanings.sent3: The tumorigenicity of the soil led to the flourishing of invasive plant species.
meanings.sent4: The tumorigenicity of the growth was evident in the abnormal cell division.
meanings.sent5: The tumorigenicity of the rock formation hinted at its volcanic origins.
